alert.note: Alert for Henry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 7:34PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Virginia and southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in south central Virginia, City of Martinsville and Henry. In southwest Virginia, Patrick. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hairston Branch, Goblintown Creek, Grays Fork, Jordan Creek, Koger Creek, Beaver Creek, Bassett Branch, Bull Run, Jackson Branch, Blackberry Creek, Horse Pasture Creek and Leatherwood Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Martinsville... Spencer... Bassett... Ridgeway... Horse Pasture... Fieldale... Villa Heights... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
